scrabble

Class BoardCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • scrabble.BoardCell

  • public class BoardCell
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a single Cell of the Scrabble 2D Board. A Cell consists of it's position on the 2D board, a letter and point multipliers.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    George Piskas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoardCell(int x, int y)
      Cell constructor, sets position.
      BoardCell(int x, int y, int wordMltp, int letterMltp)
      Cell constructor, sets position and multipliers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getLetter()
      Returns cell letter.
      int getLetterMult()
      Returns cell's letter multiplier.
      int getWordMult()
      Returns cell's word multiplier.
      double getX()
      Returns cell's X position.
      double getY()
      Returns cell's Y position.
      void setCellMult(int wm, int lm)
      Sets both multiplier values to the cell.

      Sets a letter to the cell.

      Sets letter multiplier only.

      Sets word multiplier only.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns all cell's information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardCell

        public BoardCell(int x,
         int y)
        Cell constructor, sets position. Sets the location of the cell, multipliers to 0 and letter to ' '.
        Parameters:
        x - X position on the board
        y - Y position on the board

      • BoardCell

        public BoardCell(int x,
         int y,
         int wordMltp,
         int letterMltp)
        Cell constructor, sets position and multipliers. Sets the location of the cell, multipliers to given values and letter to ' '.
        Parameters:
        x - X position on the board
        y - Y position on the board
        wordMltp - Word point multiplier
        letterMltp - Letter point multiplier

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns all cell's information.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Info returned in the following form:
        Position: (x,y)
        Word Multiplier: *
        Letter Multiplier: *
